alert.note: Alert for Bayfield; Douglas; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN BAYFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHEASTERN WASHBURN AND NORTHWESTERN SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gordon, or 20 miles northwest of Hayward, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Bayfield, southeastern Douglas, northeastern Washburn and northwestern Sawyer Counties, including the following locations... Springbrook, Totagatic Flowage, Stanberry, Nelson Lake and Totagatic Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
